programme.title: Wildest Islands: The Hebrides: Land of Legends
programme.desc: Just off the coast of west Scotland, the Hebrides archipelago is made up of more than 500 islands and islets. A perfect breeding ground for millions of creatures. /Japan's 7,000 islands stretch for over 2,400 km, and cover an incredible range of climates.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Ethiopia: Land of Extremes
programme.desc: Landlocked and surrounded by five countries, Ethiopia is one of east Africa's forgotten lands. Seemingly passive deserts in fact seethe with fire, and cloud-piercing peaks shield a secret Eden of canyons and cliff-tops teeming with life.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Zambezi: Wild Water
programme.desc: The Zambezi is one of Africa's most influential rivers. It supports some of the continent's most spectacular wildlife. However, the Zambezi's long and winding journey destroys, as well as creates.

programme.title: Wildest Indochina: Southwest China: China's Secret Garden
programme.desc: Tucked away in China's southwest corner is a hidden oasis unlike any other. Snow-capped mountains, temperate valleys and tropical jungles are home to a spectacular array of wildlife.

programme.title: Wildest Indochina: Thailand: The Wild Heart
programme.desc: Thailand is a land of extremes. A country shaped by wild forces, where animals face tough challenges to survive. Tropical rainforests, primeval caves, mangrove swamps, and rocky shorelines provide homes for remarkable creatures.

programme.title: Bottle Shock
programme.desc: The story of the early days of California wine making featuring the now infamous, blind Paris wine tasting of 1976 that has come to be known as "Judgment of Paris". Feat: Chris Pine, Alan Rickman & Bill Pullman.

programme.title: The Last Legion
programme.desc: As the Roman empire collapses, young Romulus Augustus must leave the city and set out for a dangerous journey to Britain to locate his last legion of supporters.

programme.title: The Beatniks
programme.desc: When a hold-up carried out by his hoodlum friends goes tragically awry, Eddie Crane’s bright future as a recording artist could be in jeopardy.

programme.title: Untamed Youth

programme.title: Girl in Gold Boots
programme.desc: A girl from rural California goes to Los Angeles to work as a go-go dancer, but soon gets involved with drug dealers.

programme.title: Beginning of the End

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's: Fire It Up!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's: The Lockdown Duel, Part 1
programme.desc: After being sent to the Maximum Security Zone in The Facility, Yusei risks being permanently placed in lockdown when he decides to duel Chief Armstrong in order to win a pardon for his pal.

programme.title: Andromeda: Lost in a Space That Isn't There
programme.desc: The Abyss has infected Beka. The crew must find a way to save her.

programme.title: Andromeda: Abridging the Devil's Divide
programme.desc: After some of the crew is captured, Harper is forced to work on a time bridge for the Patriarch.

programme.title: Sensing Murder
programme.desc: “Sensing Murder” psychics are challenged to connect with the spirit of 53-year-old, Cynthia Greenwood-Smith, to unravel the lies and discover the grim truth surrounding her disappearance from her Gold Coast home in 2001.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Little Boy Lost
programme.desc: In 1957, nine-year-old Peter Boland was on holiday having the time of his life on a remote farm in New Zealand when he simply vanished without a trace. Peter’s older brother Gavin Boland, a self-confessed sceptic, turns to Sensing Murder’s psychics.

programme.title: Sensing Murder: Lost for Words
programme.desc: Spirited teenager Jayne Furlong dreamed of becoming a child psychologist - instead, she ended up a prostitute. In 1993, 17 year old Jayne vanished from her patch on Auckland's Karangahape Road.

programme.title: Sensing Murder
programme.desc: 19-year-old Joan Wech left New Zealand for the bright lights of Sydney. But the first step on her overseas adventure would be her last. Was this a robbery gone wrong, a savage random attack or a revenge killing by a jealous ex-lover?

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Mystery of the Homestead Murders
programme.desc: The quick mind of a country telephone exchange supervisor led to a horrific discovery at a NSW country homestead in 1978.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Anita Cobby Murder
programme.desc: In February 1986, nurse Anita Cobby, a former entrant in the Miss Australia quest, is walking home from Blacktown station in Sydney's outer-western suburbs. A Holden sedan pulls up and Anita is dragged into the vehicle.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Contract to Kill / The Mornington Monster
programme.desc: Crime Investigation Australia has conducted a major investigation which reveals the inside story of the Megan Kalajzich murder and the extraordinary police investigation which will rock the Harbour City's elite to the core.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: The Killing Fields of Truro
programme.desc: For the 2008 launch of Crime Investigation Australia, CI presents the complete and compelling story of "The Killing Fields of Truro", one of the most infamous crimes in Australia and yet another set in Adelaide.

programme.title: Crime Investigation Australia: Kid for Ransom / Tears for Daniel
programme.desc: We examine two notorious abduction cases. The first case is the Graeme Thorne ransom kidnapping at Bondi in 1960. Thorne, aged eight, was the son of winners of the Sydney Opera House Lottery.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Secrets and Lies
programme.desc: Stevie discovers that Fiona is lying about being pregnant. Racing to stop the wedding, Stevie is too late - Fiona has fast-tracked the ceremony before Stevie can tell Alex.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: The Life of Riley
programme.desc: When brumbies are found shot dead, the Drovers girls suspect Riley, a handsome stranger. Sandra moves back into Killarney, convinced she is carrying out Harry's legacy. Moira and Regan go into a fuel carting business together.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Wild Horses
programme.desc: Stevie and Riley clash over horse training techniques when the pressure is on to have a horse ready for sale in a day.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: The Great Temptation
programme.desc: Moira’s husband Hugh returns to Gungellan, wanting her back. Regan saves the day when she discovers that a paratyphoid outbreak on Drovers is the result of Sandra’s dirty work.

programme.title: McLeod's Daughters: Suspicious Minds
programme.desc: When evidence mounts against Stevie, Kate starts to believe that she could be guilty of Harry Ryan’s murder. Riley reacts badly when a local trainer is revealed to be abusing his horses.

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada
programme.desc: Lisa Lisson, the first female president of FedEx Express Canada, goes undercover to find out if her employees have the right resources to provide exceptional service in the fiercely competitive courier industry.

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada
programme.desc: Pizza Pizza CEO Paul Goddard goes undercover in the nation’s number one pizza mega brand, and learns that making dough and delivering pizza serves up some challenges he never imagined.

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Rick Tigner, the president of Kendall-Jackson Wine Estates, the second largest family owned wine company in the world, goes undercover posing as a grocery store employee who is pursuing his dream job in the wine industry.

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada
programme.desc: Brian Scudamore, 1-800-GOT-JUNK? founder and CEO, goes undercover as a driver and junk collector, hauling loads of unwanted clutter in the world’s largest junk removal franchise, and comes out collecting something much more valuable.

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada
programme.desc: CEO Ellis Jacob goes undercover doling out snacks and tickets while assessing how to enhance the moviegoer experience within Canada’s largest motion picture exhibitor across the board.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters
programme.desc: Despite mysterious and unnerving warnings from locals, the Ghost Hunters face their fears and stay on mission: to help people confront terrifying paranormal encounters that have shaken them to their core.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: French Quarter Massacre
programme.desc: On this episode of Ghost Hunters, TAPS heads out to New Orleans, Louisiana to investigate their first case without Grant: The Jimani Lounge Massacre.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: The Oldest House In Georgia
programme.desc: On this episode of Ghost Hunters, TAPS starts out at the Ulster County Jail in Kingston, NY, where inmates and personal have both witnessed activity.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Scream Park
programme.desc: On this episode of Ghost Hunters, TAPS travels to Sylvan Beach, New York where the new owner of a historic amusement park finds himself in the middle of a mystery.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Prescription For Fear
programme.desc: On this episode of Ghost Hunters, TAPS travels to Bartonville, Illinois to investigate the Peoria Asylum.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Tender Trap
programme.desc: When Dog discovers today's prey is a notorious ladies man, he knows just how to lure him in. The trap includes a suggestive phone call, a motel rendezvous, and a crew of bounty hunters waiting in the next room ready to break up the party!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Greed is Good
programme.desc: Today's fugitive is accused of assaulting a police officer, so Dog and the team are not taking any chances. Dog has to play on his target's greed and deploy some modern technology to set a trap for this runner.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Tears for Fears
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa wakes up in a jail cell, but ignores the ensuing media frenzy in order to befriend a woman waging a personal battle against drug addiction.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Picture This
programme.desc: A fugitive with a long criminal record has fled to Hawaii, and the bondsman on the mainland has asked Dog for help. Dog doesn't have much information to work with, but he can use the felon's desire to impress his friends to track him down.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Tag, You're It
programme.desc: To his traditional bounty hunting tools of confidential informants, canvassing, and silver-tongued subterfuge the world's greatest bounty hunter has added Facebook! A word to the wise for those on the run-post at your own peril, the Dog is watching!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: A Family Affair
programme.desc: Dog likes to say, "The apple doesn't fall far from the tree," and this is a hunt where that is true. So will Dog be able to use one family member's troubled ways to catch another one in trouble with the law?

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Razing the Snakes
programme.desc: Jase, Jep, Si and Cole try to fight back a growing population of cottonmouth snakes on Phil's property. Meanwhile, Willie uses his business expertise to help Rebecca improve her clothing store.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Uneasy Rider
programme.desc: Willie puts Little Will on a budget for his first car but it backfires when Will decides to get a motorcycle instead. Jase and the guys are inspired to design a product using zip lines that will revolutionize duck hunting.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Good Willie Hunting
programme.desc: While many of the guys' wives and children are in Africa doing charity work, Willie and Jase get into a debate over tracking ability which leads to a challenge--can Jase and Si track and capture Willie and Jep?

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Sleep Cover
programme.desc: With Korie still in Africa, Willie and Jep must step in and supervise Bella's sleepover. When a couple boys play a prank on the girls, Willie and Jep prove to be the perfect chaperones for the task.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Drive-In Revivin'
programme.desc: Korie challenges Willie to come up with a romantic gesture without spending any money. Missy and Jase compete to see who can find a girlfriend for Mountain Man.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Fishful Thinking
programme.desc: Jase's hopes to win the inaugural Duck Commander Fishing Tournament is buoyed when he is able to enlist the help of legendary angler Bill Dance. Meanwhile, Willie's vanity over his greying beard leads him to make a questionable decision.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: When Doves Fry
programme.desc: Jase and Jep make a deal with Mia and Merritt to get them to go dove hunting with them. Si tries to make some extra cash by starting a West Monroe tour.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Carpnado
programme.desc: Jumping Asian carp have invaded Monroe's waters so Jase and the guys set out to try to stop them from spreading further. Meanwhile, Willie and Si have to run Willie's Duck Diner for the day.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: The Campfire Diaries
programme.desc: The family spends a weekend at their childhood summer camp, reliving old memories and working to repair a tennis court Willie built twenty years ago. While at the camp, Jep tries to pass a lifeguard swimming test he failed as a teenager.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Rowdy's Big Day
programme.desc: Rowdy's adoption is finalized and he officially becomes a Robertson. Jase gets his first massage and enjoys it more than he expected.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Disappearing Acts
programme.desc: After Willie and Jase lose Si's tea cup, Si makes them go to great lengths to find it. When the entertainment for Gus's 1st birthday party falls through, Jep fills in as a magician.

programme.title: Timber Kings: Jolly Ole Island
programme.desc: Joel assembles a millionaire’s retreat on a private island in England, Beat gets an emotional assignment, and Peter cannot take a vacation until he completes an HQ remodel for The Chief’s return.

programme.title: Timber Kings: Peter in a Pickle
programme.desc: Peter goes to Scotland and discovers that his boss Bryan Sr. has followed, Beat and André face a client with buyer’s remorse, while Joel agrees to build an elaborate doghouse and birdhouse, all for a slice of cake.

programme.title: Timber Kings: Wilderness Retreat
programme.desc: Joel builds an enormous house in the wilderness for a millionaire client he’s never met, Bryan Sr. promises to make log furniture and Beat must deliver, while Peter plays the role of a lifetime.

programme.title: Timber Kings: German Efficiency
programme.desc: Beat’s schedule is thrown by German customs and there’s only one way to catch up, Bryan Sr. takes Peter to the wilderness and they harvest 200-foot trees.

programme.title: Timber Kings: Arkansas Shuffle
programme.desc: Beat sets logs in the pouring Arkansas rain for a client who orders renovations on the fly, a Catholic priest convinces Bryan Sr. and Peter to build a wedding gazebo for free.

programme.title: Timber Kings: The Boss Can Build
programme.desc: André the GM and master salesman must go to Ontario and lead his first build in more than 10 years, Beat has to collaborate in carving a hairy friend.

programme.title: Divorce Court: House Car
programme.desc: Latoya Ward and Davarius Greaves are back for round two! Latoya wants Davarius to become a stay at home dad because he can’t keep a job. Davarius says Latoya sabotages any work he can get and goes out of her way to create hostile environments.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Johnny on the Spot
programme.desc: Cornisha says Jawaun leaves for weeks at a time and returns broke and jobless. He says Cornisha is too bossy and picks fights causing him to blow up and take days away to cool down. Will they find a cooling point before their relationship melts down?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Tardy for the Party
programme.desc: Dashia says William is a cheater and spends most of his money on alcohol instead of paying the bills. William says Dashia is sneaky, belittles him, has trust issues and allows her family to interfere in their relationship.

programme.title: Divorce Court: In and Out
programme.desc: Willard says he’s getting tired of this roller coaster ride of a relationship with Cynthia and he’s had just about as much as he can take with her lies and deception.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Player of the Year
programme.desc: Jordan says that Taurean is the biggest player with the ladies and still decides to lie about it even after she gave him a chance to have an open relationship. He says he talks to other women because Jordan is unaffectionate and verbally abusive.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Like a Virgin
programme.desc: Emily is 29 and a virgin. The pressure from her boyfriend Romeo to have sex is overwhelming. Their 20 year age difference may be part of the problem because she chats it up more with strangers than him. Can Judge Toler help them find common ground?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Brexit
programme.desc: Over 17 years of marriage Leon has had countless affairs with other women and Siobhan has had it. She claims all he wants is for her to keep his house clean and pick up after him. Leon argues that the problems stem from Siobhan’s bad drinking habits.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Secret Lies
programme.desc: Billy wants Marylu to quit pole dancing and stripping, while she wants Billy to confess if he’s straight or not. Billy has a fetish for wearing women’s underwear and he needs to fess up if he likes women, men or both.

programme.title: Divorce Court: Can't Buy Love
programme.desc: Chimira gets lavish vacations, gifts and a designer wardrobe from Bennie, but suspects he is cheating on her. Bennie says she should be grateful for her good life. Can Bennie learn to give his time and support instead of luxuries and an empty home?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Not Man Enough
programme.desc: No matter how hard Demont tries, he's always looking up at the bar Reasha keeps raising. Demont got a promotion and relocated for work, which raised her suspicions of him cheating. Can this couple ignite the spark or is this relationship totaled?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Nana Bread
programme.desc: Markia says Herb's overactive sex drive is ruining their relationship because he wants it daily. When Herb doesn't get his way, he throws major tantrums. Can Herb learn to take breathers or has this 11 year relationship taking its toll?

programme.title: Divorce Court: Dead Weight
programme.desc: They say opposites attract, but Betty is starting to feel weighed down by David. David is lazy and disrespectful for how broke he is all the time. Betty no longer wants to be tied down by being with someone who is always unemployed and lies about it.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: And Baby Makes Three
programme.desc: Leland has to attend a Lamaze class before he can join the hunt--another Chapman is on the way! But when Dog starts to go after this accused jewelry thief without his fastest son, he learns that this fugitive puts the "R" in runner.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Tender Trap
programme.desc: When Dog discovers today's prey is a notorious ladies man, he knows just how to lure him in. The trap includes a suggestive phone call, a motel rendezvous, and a crew of bounty hunters waiting in the next room ready to break up the party!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Greed is Good
programme.desc: Today's fugitive is accused of assaulting a police officer, so Dog and the team are not taking any chances. Dog has to play on his target's greed and deploy some modern technology to set a trap for this runner.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Tears for Fears
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa wakes up in a jail cell, but ignores the ensuing media frenzy in order to befriend a woman waging a personal battle against drug addiction.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Picture This
programme.desc: A fugitive with a long criminal record has fled to Hawaii, and the bondsman on the mainland has asked Dog for help. Dog doesn't have much information to work with, but he can use the felon's desire to impress his friends to track him down.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Tag, You're It
programme.desc: To his traditional bounty hunting tools of confidential informants, canvassing, and silver-tongued subterfuge the world's greatest bounty hunter has added Facebook! A word to the wise for those on the run-post at your own peril, the Dog is watching!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: A Family Affair
programme.desc: Dog likes to say, "The apple doesn't fall far from the tree," and this is a hunt where that is true. So will Dog be able to use one family member's troubled ways to catch another one in trouble with the law?

programme.title: Run's House: When the Cat's Away...
programme.desc: Justine's Brown Sugar jewelry line is up and running. And better yet, the Home Shopping Network is interested in working with her. So it's off to sunny Tampa to put Justine's jewelry on air.

programme.title: Run's House: Slapped Silly
programme.desc: Every family has its pecking order and being the youngest sure has its drawbacks: like getting picked on, which makes Russy the target of his brothers and sisters annoyance.

programme.title: Run's House: Rev's Baby Girl
programme.desc: It's time for JoJo and his group, Blackout, to hit the studio and begin recording tracks for their record. However, JoJo, Zach and Reggie are discouraged by the list of producers Latchkey Recordings has available to them.

programme.title: Run's House: Baby Comes Home
programme.desc: Rev and Justine return from visiting their adopted baby they'll soon be able to call their own. They get the family excited with the news that they will have a new sister living in the house in a few days.

programme.title: Run's House: Mind on the Road
programme.desc: Season Five kicks off when Rev Run home for a short visit in between gigs of his concert tour with good pal, Kid Rock.

programme.title: Run's House: Bonless Chicken Dinner
programme.desc: The episode begins with Rev Run on stage in what is his final performance of his tour with Kid Rock. Rev returns home and his hopes of getting his diet back on track are thwarted by Russy's new cooking hobby.

programme.title: Run's House: Pass The Frame
programme.desc: With the final mix of their debut album just around the corner, Team Blackout takes the next step in their pursuit of ultimate rap dominance: self-promotion.

programme.title: Run's House: Outside The Box
programme.desc: Making the Honor Roll has been something Rev and Justine have come to expect from Diggy and Russy over the years. So when their latest report cards show them not making it, Rev confronts the boys about it.

programme.title: Run's House: Mole Beauty, Mole Problems
programme.desc: A trip to the orthodontist for Diggy and Russy brings the family some surprising news: That Russy will be getting his braces off before Diggy, who will have to wait another two months.

programme.title: Run's House: Rev's Ol' Wild West
programme.desc: With their Spring Break on the horizon, Diggy and Russy try to convince Rev and Justine to take them on a trip. Rev decides that the family should take the vacation package that he won in a Rush Philanthropic charity auction.

programme.title: Run's House: Age Against The Machine
programme.desc: With their first book written together, "Take Back Your Family," now complete, Rev and Jus begin the process of recording the book on tape version.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Devil's Hostage
programme.desc: When a woman has long scratch marks mysteriously appear on her back, PRS is called in to see if they are truly facing the devil. But her credibility is called into question, a struggle of another kind emerges for Ryan and the rest of the team.

programme.title: Paranormal State: The Ladder
programme.desc: A large family in Shrewsbury, MA, has been living with a spirit for the last 40 years. To most of the siblings, the entity is menacing and evil, but Sandy seems to have a different connection.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Lost Souls
programme.desc: PRS and Psychic/medium Michelle Belanger investigate a Pennsylvania home; where a mother named Kathy and her son Michael have both felt the presence of a young boy and hear voices calling, "Mom?" but no one is there.

programme.title: Paranormal State: The Firehouse
programme.desc: Everyone from the chief to the trainees at the Clementon Fire Department is convinced that the ghost of a former member is haunting their firehouse.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Devil in Jersey
programme.desc: PRS delves deep into the pine barrens of the Garden State to separate myth from reality about the so-called "Jersey Devil." Accompanied by a cryptozoologist the team interviews eye witnesses and experts in search of the truth.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Haunted Connection
programme.desc: P.R.S. is called in to help a young mother tormented by an otherworldly connection to a teenage girl murdered in her neighborhood years ago. Could she have psychic ability or is there a more sinister force at work?

programme.title: Paranormal State: Requiem
programme.desc: A young woman named Kristy has been haunted in her own bedroom since she can remember. Now it's up to Ryan and the crew to help Kristy before she's overwhelmed by the entity.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Shape Shifter
programme.desc: PRS travels to Shapleigh, Maine where a woman and her daughter are reporting attacks from a winged creature with sharp teeth. Psychic Chip Coffey arrives and senses a half-human, half animal presence.

programme.title: Paranormal State: They Only Come Out at Night
programme.desc: Once night falls in a quaint?New England Town, a police officer's family is terrorized by demons.?PRS arrives just in time with the family ready to vacate their family home, rather than suffer the advances of these spirit creatures.

programme.title: Paranormal State: Mothman
programme.desc: Ryan takes his team to Point Pleasant, West Virginia to investigate his own personal holy grail of paranormal lore: the mysterious Mothman.

programme.title: Paranormal State: First Contact
programme.desc: Washington State, a hotbed of unexplained paranormal activity. Between possible UFOs in the sky and winged creatures in the woods, Ryan and his team are forced to face their fears and deal with the question: Are we truly alone in the universe?

programme.title: NEW & EXCLUSIVE! MOST HAUNTED
programme.desc: The Most Haunted team visit this deserted old mansion which is way past its original splendour. They are soon surrounded by unexplained activity as something is following them and for at least two members of crew, they are pushed to their very limits.

programme.title: NEW & EXCLUSIVE! MOST HAUNTED
programme.desc: An all but deserted manor house that boasts murder, death and intrigue among its history becomes the setting for one of the most intriguing investigation to date. The team are showered with object that appear to land in the same way.

programme.title: NEW & EXCLUSIVE! MOST HAUNTED
programme.desc: Yvette and team are put to the test as activity seems to be all around them, something is following them but who or what. Could it be the spirit of a man they connect who died near the house over 100 years ago?

programme.title: NEW & EXCLUSIVE! MOST HAUNTED
programme.desc: Yvette and team are put to the test as activity seems to be all around them, something is following them but who or what. Could it be the spirit of a man they connect who died near the house over 100 years ago?

programme.title: NEW & EXCLUSIVE! MOST HAUNTED
programme.desc: From the start activity prevalent in this historical building. Glen is faced with something unexplained early on, Gregg is faced with his most demanding vigil yet and the rest of team chase a sinister shadow that lurks in the dark corridor

programme.title: NEW & EXCLUSIVE! MOST HAUNTED
programme.desc: Yvette and her team continue their investigation, moving from the cellar to the upper floors. While Yvette and Glen explore the auditorium, something follows Karl upstairs, and the rest of the team captures some of their best evidence yet.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: Alone
programme.desc: A homeless boy wishes that someone would love him.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: Close Encounters of the Heavenly Kind
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark help a bullied orphan whose eccentric grandfather is in danger of losing him to a heartless social worker.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: Change of Life
programme.desc: Mark switches places with an attractive movie star who has a low opinion of men.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: Keep Smiling
programme.desc: Jonathan must help his own widow regain her love for life.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven: The Last Assignment
programme.desc: An errant angel has been on probation for two centuries because he's always breaking the rules.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 1
programme.desc: While on honeymoon in London, Alice discovers that Danny has some final business to do before they can return home to Africa. He's reluctantly arranged to meet his estranged father, Robert, who has recently got back in touch.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 2

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 3
programme.desc: It is Danny's first day as State Vet and when he helps rescue some smuggled animals he feels he's making a difference. However, he discovers the role isn't going to be all plain sailing.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 4
programme.desc: Danny's first big project as State Vet is a major animal translocation, and he is desperate to impress. Meanwhile, whilst Alice is out in the bush treating an injured zebra, she is stalked by lions. She makes it back to her jeep in time but is shaken up.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 5
programme.desc: Alice is still suffering from a loss of nerve after her close shave with the lions and so Danny tries to help her overcome her problems – the Leopard's Den lions have produced their first cub and he needs Alice back in the saddle.

programme.title: Wild At Heart: Episode 6
programme.desc: In his role as State Vet, Danny works with wealthy conservationist, Anton Ziegler, to catch a group of leopard hunters. Ziegler is also buying a tiger from Vanessa, who struggling with her finances, desperately needs the money to ensure Mara's future.

programme.desc: When the fleet stops at the planet Carillon to refuel and pick up supplies, a newly-elected member of the Council seizes power from Commander Adama.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Glaciers
programme.desc: Clinging to the world’s highest mountains and forming ice caps on both poles, glaciers leave an impression on the landscape and on all who bear witness to their splendor.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Water Adventures
programme.desc: We are captivated by oceans, rivers, and lakes - the power, the flow, the reflective stillness. And as we seek to get closer, we immerse ourselves in an expanding range of aquatic experiences.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Bridges
programme.desc: A bridge is a structure that’s designed to transcend, but a great bridge can define the place where it stands. Symbols of human ingenuity, beauty, and grandeur, bridges connect us not only to each other but also to the past.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Wetland Animals
programme.desc: Wetland Animals dives into the swamps, rivers, and flood plains of the Everglades, Botswana’s Okavango Delta, Kakadu National Park in Australia, and the Amazon to see deadly crocodiles, piranhas, hippopotamus, flamingo, manatee, and platypus.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Global Cities
programme.desc: Travel to the centers of wealth, power, industry, and innovation. From London to Tokyo, Hong Kong to New York, these are the cities that never sleep. The influence held in these economic hubs unites the global community.

programme.title: Arthur: Paradise Lost/The Pride of Lakewood
programme.desc: Baby Kate is growing up! But strangely enough, the more words she learns, the less she seems to understand their dog. To boost school spirit, Arthur and his classmates form the Lakewood Pride Committee, but not everyone wants to join.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur's Chicken Pox/Sick As A Dog
programme.desc: The circus is in town and the whole family's excited—until Arthur gets CHICKEN POX! Will he recover in time? Then, Arthur's worst fears come true when poor, sick Pal has to sleep overnight at the vet's office. Could it be something he did?

programme.title: Arthur: Binky Wrestles with a Story/All Will Be Revealed
programme.desc: Binky spends the day with Bitzi Baxter and learns what it's like to be a news reporter. Then, D.W., Bud, and Rapty set out to solve the mystery of what really happened to D.W.'s snowball.

programme.title: Arthur: Show Off/Dog's Best Friend
programme.desc: It's the Elwood City dog show and Killer is facing off against Sebastian Winkleplotz, the snooty, championship-winning poodle. Arthur agrees to watch Amigo while Alberto's off at camp, but Pal gets worried.

programme.title: Arthur: Arthur's Snow Biz/Bugged
programme.desc: Winter hits Elwood City and Arthur sees dollar signs! His snow-shoveling business is booming--that is, until Buster decides to get in on the action. And, Brain can be a know-it-all, and sometimes he really bugs people.

programme.title: Arthur: Sleep No More/Pet Peeved
programme.desc: Buster is convinced that Pizza Paula's all-you-can-eat contest is his destiny. But how can he possibly win such an important contest without any sleep? Binky volunteers to look after Francine's cat, Nemo, for the weekend.

programme.title: Arthur: The Chips Are Down/Revenge Of The Chip
programme.desc: What a mysterious, beautiful thing a green potato chip is--and D.W. just ate a gigantic one! But then she hears a rumor that they're poisonous...Sure, kids do some pretty embarrassing things, but do Moms have to tell everyone?

programme.title: Arthur: D.W., The Picky Eater/Buster And The Daredevils
programme.desc: It's wrong to call D.W. a picky eater. The only things she won't eat are vegetables, fish, fruit, and meat. Then, Arthur and Buster meet two really cool kids and, naturally, are utterly dazzled. How far will Buster go to be cool?

programme.title: Arthur: Big Horns George/Bleep
programme.desc: George is inspired to write and perform his own blues song when he's introduced to the music of Koko Taylor. And, D.W. overhears a mysterious word she doesn’t know the meaning of. Can D.W. risk the consequences of blurting out <"BLEEP!">?

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: By the end of the war the RAF had aircraft that could escort bombers to targets deep inside Germany and back. With the Gloster Meteor, the RAF had also entered the ‘Jet Age’. Aircraft like the Hawker Hunter and F-86 Sabre took the RAF supersonic.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: By the end of the First World War the RAF had bombers that could fly to Berlin and back. For the first time in a thousand years British civilians found themselves under direct attack - by Zeppelin airships and Gotha bombers.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: The RAF’s maritime role is often overlooked. Between the wars the RAF operated elegant flying boats to patrol the far flung corners of the Empire.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: After the war, RAF transports helped keep Berliners alive during the Soviet blockade of the city in 1948/49. As well as flying round-the-clock operations into the airport, Sunderland flying boats delivered supplies by landing on Lake Havel near the city.

programme.title: RAF: The Royal Air Force: Battle for the Skies
programme.desc: In this programme we bring the RAF story into the modern era. Another aircraft to have extended the RAF’s capabilities is the C130 Hercules. This aircraft has proved its capabilities in countless environments from resupply, to dropping paratroopers.

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: After Jonathon's online love disappears, he enlists Nev and Max to help track him down. But when the guys discover a former catfish is involved, they begin to suspect Jonathon himself. (S6, ep13)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Jordan & Austin
programme.desc: After two years of chatting, Jordan believes Austin is the one. But every time they arrange to meet, Austin cancels. Can Julie and Oobah finally bring them together? (S1, ep9)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Jasmine writes to Nev and Max asking for help for a "friend". But they're perplexed when Jasmine drops a bombshell revelation: they've helped her friend before! (S6, ep19)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Kailani has fallen for Sam, her gay friend's online ex-boyfriend. Sam claims to love Kailani, but has been acting strange since she has tried to meet up with him. Nev and Max investigate. (S6, ep9)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show
programme.desc: Southern sweetheart Kelsie is madly in love with her online Romeo, Brandon. But after years of endless excuses about meeting up, Kelsie recruits Nev and Max to find who Brandon really is. (S6, ep14)

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Keyonnah & Bow Wow
programme.desc: Superfan Keyonnah can hardly believe her luck, she's almost certain that she's been having an online relationship with her childhood crush, the rapper Bow Wow. Is this too good to be true?

programme.title: The Hills: A Change of Plans
programme.desc: Lauren has to face her boss after the party. Meanwhile, Heidi doesn't take school seriously and makes different plans for her future. (S1, ep2)

programme.title: The Hills: An Unexpected Call
programme.desc: Teen Vogue sends Lauren on an over-night errand that lands her in New York City, Heidi learns that work in party promotion isn't just a party, and Audrina looks to Brian for love. (S1, ep3)

programme.title: The Hills: Lauren and Jason: Part 2
programme.desc: When Jason, Lauren's ex flame from Laguna Beach, reappears in her life, Lauren thinks she may not be over him. Meanwhile, Heidi asks if the price of a new job is worth paying for. (S1, ep4)

programme.title: The Hills: Jason's Birthday
programme.desc: After a Teen Vogue event, Lauren hurries to get home to Jason for his birthday. However, things don't end up so well when Jason only wants to hang out with his friends. (S1, ep5)

programme.title: The Hills: Boyfriends and Work Don't Mix
programme.desc: Jason becomes a distraction in Lauren's life, Heidi finally gets her big chance to work in the nightclub, and when a model drops out from a Teen Vogue fashion show, Whitney steps in. (S1, ep6)

programme.title: The City: The L Word
programme.desc: Whitney gets mixed signals from Jay and decides to ask him directly where she stands. Erin's new boyfriend comes to visit and Whitney realizes it's time to find her own apartment. (S1, ep3)

programme.title: The City: Good Things Come In Threes
programme.desc: Whitney dates a new guy and Jay confesses to Adam his true feelings about Whitney. (S1, ep4)

programme.title: The City: Boys Night Out
programme.desc: Adam lets loose while his girlfriend Allie is out of town, but when she hears he kissed another girl from Whitney and the others, Adam finds himself in hot water. (S1, ep5)

programme.title: The City: He Never Said He Had a Girlfriend
programme.desc: Allie breaks down after a run in with the girl who claims she kissed Adam, but Adam sticks to his story to win Allie back, and Whitney gets upset with Jay for taking Adam's side. (S1, ep6)

programme.title: The City: The Truth Hurts
programme.desc: Kelly Cutrone accuses Allie of being too skinny, and Whitney finds herself caught in the middle. Erin runs into an ex-boyfriend and old feelings begin to return. (S1, ep7)

programme.title: The City: Mingling with the Commoners
programme.desc: Olivia invites Jay's band to perform at one of her charity events but her plan backfires when the band is disrespected on-stage, leaving Whitney and Olivia at odds. (s1, ep8)

programme.title: 48 Hours: Deadly Ride
programme.desc: Jane Mixer, a student at the University of Michigan Law School in March of 1969, had just agreed to get married and had arranged a ride home to tell her parents. Her body was found in a small, rural cemetery just miles from her dorm.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Fatal Attraction
programme.desc: Thomas Capano, a successful Delaware lawyer lived a double life, a devoted family man while having affairs. When Anne Marie Fahey, one of these women, mysteriously disappeared police were at first stumped. Finally evidence led to Capano.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Ambushed
programme.desc: A man helps a new detective figure out who murdered his father.

programme.title: 48 Hours: Reasonable Doubt
programme.desc: In September 1999, Brian Eftenoff of Phoenix, Az. Was convicted of murdering his wife, Judi. It was alleged that Eftenoff forced more than a gram of cocaine down his wife’s throat causing her to die of a cocaine-induced stroke.

programme.title: 48 Hours: A Daughter, A Mortgage, and Two Murders
programme.desc: A report on the investigation into the murders of Greg and Bernadette Ohlemacher in 2005. The Albuquerque, New Mexico couple had been shot dead in their home

programme.title: 48 Hours: Murder in the Fast Lane
programme.desc: A report on the March 1988 murder of legendary racecar driver Mickey Thompson and his wife Trudy. Thompson’s sister is convinced that Michael Goodwin, her brother’s former partner, was the killer.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: Action!
programme.desc: Miklos Klaar, an Iron Curtain filmmaker, has film of American soldiers and plans to edit it into an atrocity movie to discredit the U.S.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Train
programme.desc: Prime Minister Larya of Svardia is working to establish democracy, but is unaware that his personal protege, Deputy Premier Pavel, plans to set up a dictatorship.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: Shock
programme.desc: Enemy operative Kiri has kidnapped U.S. envoy Carl Wilson and has an imposter, Gort, who is impersonating him to discredit a U.S. trade agreement.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: A Cube Of Sugar
programme.desc: The IMF team must rescue a U.S. intelligence operative who has top-secret military plans on a microcircuit chip.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Traitor
programme.desc: An American intelligence officer, Hughes, has defected to the enemy with the only copy of an encoded top-secret message.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible: The Psychic
programme.desc: The team must trick a crooked investment promoter into endorsing $80 million in stolen stocks and then getting them back from him.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Play It Safe!
programme.desc: It's always fun to share a day with Barney—but it's also important to learn how to "play it safe!" Baby Bop, wanting to be a good helper, has been attaching adhesive strips to her frustrated (and uninjured) brother, BJ.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: It's A Happy Day!
programme.desc: Beth has invented a brand-new holiday called "Happy Day," in which everyone gets to make a wish for something which will make them happy—and everyone else tries to make that wish come true! Barney and the kids discuss feelings and facial expressions.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Moving Along
programme.desc: Barney plays a fun game of "Simon Says" with Baby Bop and BJ in the park. They demonstrate how to move their bodies through dancing and playing games.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: This Way In, This Way Out!
programme.desc: Angela is in the park to release her turtle after observing him with her classmates in school. Barney and the children discuss the meaning of in and out after observing the turtle going in and out of his shell.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Play Piano With Me!
programme.desc: The children learn all about the piano when they play games, listen to real pianos and even play a little themselves.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: A World of Friends
programme.desc: The children learn about many different countries while experiencing an "International Fair" on the playground.

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Easy as ABC
programme.desc: When Baby Bop uses the caboose mailbox to deliver a special invitation to her tea party, she discovers that no one can read her handwriting. Barney and his friends find creative ways to help her learn her ABCs!

programme.title: Barney and Friends: Tea-riffic Manners
programme.desc: A tea party planned by the children turns into a fun opportunity to reinforce lessons about good manners! Throughout the day, Baby Bop is given helpful advice.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Hula Moola
programme.desc: Ton and Allen jet to the Hawaiian islands where they're joined by a feisty new female assistant! The team uncovers a pair of James Bond-style gadgets designed for high-speed underwater travel and a vintage sled.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Auction Hunters, Ink.
programme.desc: Autographed 1960s Bob Shaw Swing Gate tattoo machine; Terry Ives competition 22hp chainsaw; six foot chainsaw-carved cedar bear.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Sin City Shootout
programme.desc: 1953 Chevy-inspired bumper car; scores of M16 30-round magazines; reproduction 1940s boardwalk photobooth; aerosol-powered spud gun potato launchers.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: The Fall Guys
programme.desc: The pressures of running a shop are taking a toll on Ton and Allen and not even the discovery of a stunt-man's fall bag can ease the tension. When things get heated, Ton abandons the partnership and leaves town.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: The Chicago Grand Slam
programme.desc: 1984 Yamaha SS440 Snowmobile that introduced the revolutionary shock absorber suspension; rare autographed 1920s baseball glove; mint Hank Aaron signed baseball; authentic 1950s Robby the Robot collector toy.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Betsy's Last Stand
programme.desc: With their beloved bread truck on life support, Ton and Allen head to an auction to help save her. Will an industrial grinder and a classic Chevy be enough to mend Betsy, or will the guys be forced to say goodbye for good?

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Win Lose or Joust
programme.desc: Ton and Allen race back from an auction to purchase a rare comic valued at over $100,000. The guys uncover a Samurai sword used for ritual suicide and Allen lives out his childhood fantasy of becoming knight.

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Allen's Ruff Day
programme.desc: Ton and Allen head to an auction in Ton's hometown and end up battling with a big-mouthed buyer. They discover a pair of tranquilizer dart guns and also end up fighting with a K9!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Money Makin' Monster Machines
programme.desc: The Auction Hunters team goes on the attack & ends up on a collision course with a hardened veteran auction buyer. They uncover a collection of speedy off-road vehicles and some hardcore heavy metal from the turn-of the-century!

programme.title: Auction Hunters: Whiskey Business
programme.desc: An auction in Allen's old stomping grounds triggers memories of being a "lone wolf." The guys find a set of RC race boats and when they buy a man-cave unit full of old whiskey, a night of partying leads to some tough sales.

programme.title: Teen Mom: Unseen Moments
programme.desc: Dr. Drew hosts an exclusive look at never-before seen laughs, fights and other Season 2 drama with Farrah, Maci, Catelynn, and Amber.

programme.title: Teen Mom: Baby Talk
programme.desc: Maci, Catelynn, Amber and Farrah host a look back at the cutest, most funny, and most difficult baby moments of series 2. They will also discuss their experience as young mothers.

programme.title: Teen Mom: Taking It Slow
programme.desc: Maci confronts her ex about child support; Amber makes a choice; Catelynn and Tyler consider living together; and Farrah considers a big change.

programme.title: Teen Mom: To Be With You
programme.desc: Amber and Gary move in together; Tyler's family questions his decision; Maci considers letting her boyfriend move in; Farrah struggles with the separation.

programme.title: Teen Mom: The Last Straw
programme.desc: Amber learns she is being investigated; Ryan wants to meet Maci's new boyfriend; Sophia's grandmother is suing for visitation rights; Tyler's father gets out of jail.

programme.title: Teen Mom: Trials and Tribulations
programme.desc: Catelynn wants to mend her relationship with her mother; Amber and Gary meet with CPS; Maci decides to move home; Farrah goes to court.

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: A department store manager is found dead inside his store's holiday window display,

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: The CSI team investigate when a bakery owner is gunned down on his own premises.

programme.title: CSI: NY: Smooth Criminal
programme.desc: A suave and charming hitman lead the team to uncover a conspiracy.

programme.title: CSI: NY: The Untouchable
programme.desc: The team investigate the death of a conspiracy-obsessed woman.

programme.title: CSI: NY: Do Or Die
programme.desc: The team find themselves immersed in the competitive world of overprivileged youth.

programme.title: CSI: Miami: Bad Seed
programme.desc: Delko returns to the team following an extended absence through injury.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A wedding takes a wrong turn when the bride is missing her groom.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The CSIs investigate a fatal car accident.

programme.title: CSI: Miami: Kill Clause
programme.desc: The CSIs suspect a company is killing its employees in order to profit.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A body falls from the sky and the team discover it is from a commercial space flight.

programme.title: CSI: Miami: Backfire
programme.desc: The team tries to determine the cause of a house fire.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: Into Thin Air
programme.desc: 24yr old Lorraine Laribo is dropped off at a bar by her sister's boyfriend. It's the last time anyone would ever see her alive again. Kenda must use his interrogation skills to find her killer.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: Bad Moon Rising
programme.desc: Night before Halloween, a real-life nightmare unfolds when a young man is found clinging to life. The case takes a dark turn when Lt. Joe Kenda learns there is a second victim somewhere in the woods.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: A Beautiful Shade of Death
programme.desc: When police discover the lifeless bodies of Sophia Gerardo, four children and a house cat, they suspect ritualistic mass murder. But Lt. Joe Kenda uncovers a reality far more frightening.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: Justified
programme.desc: A young man is found gunned down, leading Lt. Joe Kenda to delve into his troubled past and his connection to the world of rare coins.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: Eyes of a Child
programme.desc: A loving, churchgoing grandmother is found stabbed to death in her apartment, leaving Joe Kenda to wonder what sort of monster could do such a thing.

programme.title: Homicide Hunter: Death Grip
programme.desc: When a speeding truck crashes into a residential building, officers find the lifeless body of Michael Faast behind the wheel. But he didn’t die in the wreck – he was shot point-blank in the temple.

programme.title: The Exes
programme.desc: When Phil and Holly make a pact to ask their bosses for raises, Phil gets fired. Holly tries to help Phil get his job back. Stuart's integrity is tested when he dates a British woman with repulsive teeth.

programme.title: The Exes
programme.desc: When Holly and Eden date two charming French men who shower them with gifts and glamorous living, they wonder if their dream dates are too good to be true. Phil and Haskell train Stuart on how to confront a bully at the bar.

programme.title: The Exes

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: By chance, Grizzy discovers that the ranger's new robot vacuum cleaner also gives very pleasant back massages.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy has prepared himself a TV dinner to eat in front of his favourite series, but his moment of pleasure is abruptly interrupted by unexplained static.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: After making a fool of himself in front of the she-bear, Grizzy is ousted from the cabin by the Lemmings. But Grizzy's luck is about to change.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy can't believe his eyes when he sees objects moving all by themselves. He soon realises it's the Lemmings who are playing around with a magnet.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy is persuaded that the she-bear he's in love with has been turned into a frog. Whilst he looks through books of fairy tales, searching for a means to return his beloved to her original form, the Lemmings try to recover the frog.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings

programme.desc: Gus looks for an ore that will boost his electric pony's speed, and Grandpa Merlin tells him that he can use palladium. After finding it inside the Shadow Keep, he defeats Shadow Knight.

programme.title: Gus the Itsy Bitsy Knight

programme.title: Gus the Itsy Bitsy Knight
programme.desc: Gus wants to face the object of his recurring nightmare, a Giant Knight-Knight, head on. Iris and Tyler build a life-size giant Knight-Knight to help Gus.

programme.title: Gus the Itsy Bitsy Knight

programme.title: Gus the Itsy Bitsy Knight

programme.title: Gus the Itsy Bitsy Knight

programme.title: Gus the Itsy Bitsy Knight
programme.desc: Gus plans to train Pippy the dog to be knightlike but when Pippy gets scared but a little spider, he runs away! Our itsy bitsy friend sets off to track him down.

programme.title: Gus the Itsy Bitsy Knight
programme.desc: During a charity event, Gus decides to part with Floppy, the plush toy he had when he was a baby. But he quickly regrets getting rid of it!

programme.title: Gus the Itsy Bitsy Knight

programme.title: Gus the Itsy Bitsy Knight

programme.title: Gus the Itsy Bitsy Knight

programme.title: Gus the Itsy Bitsy Knight

programme.title: Gus the Itsy Bitsy Knight

programme.title: Gus the Itsy Bitsy Knight

programme.title: Gus the Itsy Bitsy Knight

programme.title: Gus the Itsy Bitsy Knight

programme.title: Gus the Itsy Bitsy Knight

programme.title: Super Wings

programme.title: Super Wings
programme.desc: Jett visits Australia to deliver a flower microphone to Ruby, the host of a nature talk show who claims to understand animal behaviours. Jett joins Ruby and her friend Joshua as they interview an emu, a koala, and a kangaroo.

programme.title: Super Wings

programme.title: Super Wings

programme.title: Super Wings

programme.desc: The twins think a photojournalist visiting campus may be their biological father.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: Team One thinks they have a simple case of robbery on their hands,but things get complicated when the victim sabotages the rescue.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: Team One is alerted to a situation in a bank where a woman who appears under duress is withdrawing all her money. When she sabotages her own rescue and escapes with her tormentor, the team turn their attention to her family, who is also in danger.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: As Donna gets ready to walk down the aisle, things changed drastically. She learns some surprising news regarding a mentor she once worked with.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: Team One must figure out how to get a Chinatown gang to release a local shop owner, then they also have to figure out how to get the one who shot the owner's daughter free as well.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: An ex-cop with a grudge against Greg Parker takes him hostage and threatens to drop him off an arena's megatron if Greg can't talk him down. Meanwhile his team discovers that they are helpless to use tactical options to save their boss.

programme.title: Flashpoint
programme.desc: When Spike answers Sam's sister's desperate plea for help, he is forced, at gunpoint, to help two criminals steal evidence from the fortress that is the Metro Evidence Depot.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Dipsy comes out of the house, but has to go back in to fetch the other Tubbies. They watch some children picking oranges. Laa-Laa plays with her ball indoors, but it gets stuck.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch a girl talking all about her Dad's lorry. Dipsy goes for a long walk, but the other Teletubbies decide not to join him.

programme.title: Teletubbies

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies have trouble getting out of bed. The Teletubbies watch Andy Brown and some children feeding swans.

programme.title: Teletubbies

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Laa-Laa makes some adjustments on the switch panel. The Teletubbies watch Sam and his mum blow some long horns.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Andy Brown and some children visit and aquarium to learn how things swim in the water. The Teletubbies play an in and out game when a cloud appears in Teletubbyland.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch Daniel and Stephanie make big round pancakes. They are having a round and round day. They run round and round in Teletubbyland, but they stop to see the dancing bear in the Carousel, then there's time for one more dance.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: The Teletubbies watch an traditional Christmas insert featuring children from a school in Scarborough. They are all busy making snowballs. All the snowballs are different sizes.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Dipsy and Laa-Laa go for a walk and have fun saying hello to Tinky Winky and Po. The Teletubbies watch Alex Pascall share the story of the 'Owl Babies' with some children.

programme.title: Skyscrapers and Car Parks
programme.desc: Join Bob on his next visit On Site! Follow Bob and the team as they take us through the construction of skyscrapers & car parks. Learn how skyscrapers are built up high on strong foundations and see how lifts are needed to carry people to the top.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: After a stormy night, Wendy has to mend a chimney pot at Mrs Potts’, while Bob repairs a drainage pipe for Farmer Pickles. A wire fence has been blown away at the farm too, but fixing the pipe takes priority.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: An old Willow tree has toppled over and needs to be chopped down. Lofty and Bob are going to make it safe and use the wood for other things. Meanwhile Travis and Sumsy wonder why they haven’t got a shelter of their own like Bob’s machines.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob’s just finished tidying his mobile home when Farmer Pickles comes and asks if he’ll help with his Sunflower Harvest. He needs a silo built in which to store the ripe sunflowers before they’re taken to the factory.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: It is Wendy’s birthday, but she insists she doesn’t want any fuss – such as a surprise party. She heads off to start the day’s work, laying a Heritage Trail around the town, and Bob reveals to the Machines that he is not planning a party.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is putting up some new signs in Sunflower Valley to help people find their way round the valley. Meanwhile Dizzy has been asked by Ela Stevenson if she’ll be the ‘walking bus’ and help the children get to school.

programme.title: Trains and Treehouses
programme.desc: Bob and his ‘Can-Do’ crew are back on site with a brand new adventure! Join Bob as he builds a train set for Mr Bentley as a birthday surprise and helps find a family of squirrels a new tree-house home.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: The team are building Sunflower Valley’s first geodesic dome. As Wendy has organised the dome and knows how it all fits together, Bob suggests that she might like to take charge of the job. Reluctantly Wendy agrees.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Farmer Pickles is having problems with mice eating his barley seed so he asks Bob to build a seed store to keep it safe. Whilst Bob is working, Farmer Pickles decides to go and buy some replacement seed.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: A fierce storm is forecast for Bobsville. At the farm Travis stays safe and snug in his shed, while Spud takes cover in a large barn. The storm causes a lot of damage and a tree falls on Spud’s barn – he’s okay, but his nose is a bit squashed!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is rendering a wall for Mr Sabatini. The job is straightforward, but the finished result looks rather plain, so Bob offers to get some tiles from JJ’s yard to decorate it. While Bob is gone, Mr Sabatini demonstrates his soccer skills to Dizzy.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob is erecting a tent to accommodate some newcomers to the valley. Mr Bentley is organising everything, but unfortunately leaves his phone with Spud who promptly declares himself ‘Mr Bentley’s Assistant’.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Stephanie Slater
programme.desc: Estate agent Stephanie Slater reveals the story of her abduction, rape and incarceration, which occurred in 1992 whilst showing a man around a house.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Angus Sinclair
programme.desc: Angus Sinclair, called Scotland's worst serial killer, is linked to the 1977 murders of two girls in Edinburgh.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Stepping Hill
programme.desc: An inside look at the series of mysterious deaths that occurred at Stepping Hill Hospital in Stockport, Greater Manchester, in 2011.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Keith Blakelock
programme.desc: In 1985, PC Keith Blakelock was murdered during a riot on a housing estate in London, triggered after a black woman died of heart failure during a house search. Nobody has been brought to justice for his murder, despite three investigations.

programme.title: Crimes That Shook Britain: Manchester
programme.desc: The series returns to take a closer look at the most horrific crimes ever committed on British soil, starting with the May 2017 Manchester Arena bombing.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Willie Or Won't He III: This Time It's Personal
programme.desc: After years of on-again, off-again dating and a pair of broken engagements, William and Monica finally tie the knot. At the reception, Robert Dooling, one of William’s biggest clients, thanks him for delaying his honeymoon to oversee an important merger.

programme.title: Girlfriends: What Had Happened Was...
programme.desc: After Aaron and Joan experience an uncomfortable moment when they run into one of Aaron's ex-girlfriends, they decide to discuss their past relationships with one another to avoid future awkward moments.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Church Lady
programme.desc: After splitting from Eldon over his objection to pre-marital sex, Lynn longs to get back together. She feels they share a special connection, but Eldon doesn’t appreciate Lynn’s attempts to seduce him.

programme.title: Girlfriends: A Dingo Ate My Dream House
programme.desc: Tired of all the inconveniences of living in the suburbs, Darnell (Khalil Kain) suggests to Maya (Golden Brooks) they should move back to the city, but Maya disagrees and does not want to give up her new home.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Operation Does She Yield
programme.desc: Ever since Monica left William, his life’s been a mess. He can’t work, eat or function normally. Because Joan, Maya, and Lynn feel responsible for driving Monica away, they decide they’ve got to do something to bring the couple back together.

programme.title: Girlfriends: A House Divided
programme.desc: When Lynn's (Persia White) new boyfriend Eldon (Kadeem Hardison), finds himself at odds with the church members over his choice of having Lynn as a girlfriend, he is faced with a tough decision.

programme.title: Girlfriends: To Be Determined / It's Been Determined
programme.desc: Joan (Tracee Ellis Ross) unexpectedly proposes to Aaron (guest star Richard T. Jones), but when he stumbles on his response, Joan decides the relationship is over and walks away.

programme.title: Girlfriends: It's Been Determined
programme.desc: Joan (Tracee Ellis Ross) unexpectedly proposes to Aaron (guest star Richard T. Jones), but when he stumbles on his response, Joan decides the relationship is over and walks away.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Range of Emotions
programme.desc: When Joan buys an expensive new kitchen range for their new house, her fiance Aaron gets upset that she spent money without discussing it with him.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Baghdad, My Bad
programme.desc: In order to prevent Aaron from going to Iraq, Joan kidnaps him and takes him to Mexico. In Mexico, Aaron explains to Joan that he cannot run away from the war and suggests they get married before he leaves.

programme.title: Girlfriends: Where Did Lynn-Digo?
programme.desc: When Lynn meets Xander, a cute student at UCLA, he asks her to perform at a rally raising awareness to save the environment. But when Lynn's manager gets her a gig at the House of Blues for the same day, she must decide where she will perform.

programme.title: We Hate Kids
programme.desc: Nick Pearson is a life-long bachelor who is finally settling down. On the brink of his wedding, he is surprised to find he has a 13-year-old son who located him through the help of a psychic.

programme.title: Push
programme.desc: Superhumans defy a government plot to harness and abuse their powers. Chris Evans and Dakota Fanning (the TWILIGHT films) team in a pulse-pounding paranormal thriller.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Through Your Eyes

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Time Bomb

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: The Fields

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Apparition
programme.desc: Liam investigates the suspicious death of a banker, which he saw in a dream. It seems to be an exiled Taelon spirit that is contacting him. Da'an berates Zo'or for his money and power hungry attitude.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: One Taelon Avenue
programme.desc: Joshua Doors is running his own technology development company and Renee goes undercover to find out what is going on. An artificial intelligence program of the Taelons that controls human minds seems to be acting on its own.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Abduction

programme.title: The Lost World: Divine Right

programme.title: The Lost World: Skin Deep
programme.desc: When Marguerite begins acting uncharacteristically nice, the group raises some questions. A stumbling dinosaur in the jungle holds the answer: an alien life force has begun controlling their bodies.

programme.title: The Lost World: London Calling
programme.desc: Nelson discovers a map that shows a way off the plateau, but he has doubts about leaving. The group has to outrun nomads as they follow the route out of the Lost Word.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Prisoner
programme.desc: A shape-shifter convinces Veronica that her parents are in a place called El Dorado. When Veronica takes off without telling the others, she unwittingly releases a powerful giant from captivity.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Games
programme.desc: Empress Centuria orders her Lizardmen to capture Tribune. When her soldiers find him at the treehouse, he, Malone, Marguerite, and Roxton are imprisoned, and thrown into the Gladiators' Arena.

programme.title: The Lost World: The Source
programme.desc: With all of Lost World thirsting for water, the explorers are attacked by raptors. They are aided by a young woman, Ana, and Marguerite becomes interested in her knowledge of the Fountain of Youth.

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen and Waldemar Januszczak turn things upside down on the experts. Teaming up against veterans Charles Hanson and Charlie Ross, it's Arty vs. Antiques through Cheshire and Staffordshire--in a stylish Jaguar XJS.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Day four of Anita Manning and Mark Stacey's journey from St. Helen Auckland to Darlington is derailed when their car breaks down.

programme.title: Catfish UK: Hayley & Alex

programme.title: Catfish UK: Alex & Matt
programme.desc: Alex has been chatting to Matt for a year and thinks he could be the one. But after several failed attempts to meet, Alex wants Julie and Oobah to track him down. (S1, ep5)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Rob & Sarah
programme.desc: Oobah is joined by Nathan Henry to help Rob track down his soulmate, Sarah. After two and a half years, Sarah has suddenly gone quiet and it's up to Oobah and Nathan to investigate. (S2, ep7)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Levi & Will
programme.desc: Levi is convinced Will is his dream man and broke up with his boyfriend so they could be together. After always cancelling on Levi, Oobah and Nella suspect something fishy is going on. (S2, ep2)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Luke & Amy
programme.desc: Drummer Luke first started talking to nurse Amy when she came to one of his gigs 6 months ago. They had an instant spark but unfortunately every time they try and meet she cancels. (S2, ep9)

programme.title: Catfish UK: Emma & Harlin

programme.title: 48 Hours
programme.desc: A report on the investigation into the 1960 murder of Irena Garza, in McAllen, Texas, and the efforts that family members and police have taken to bring the suspect, a Roman Catholic priest, to trial for the crime.

programme.title: 48 Hours

programme.title: 100 Years of Horror
programme.desc: Nothing like a good ghost story  except a centurys worth of films filled with more ghost stories!

programme.title: 100 Years of Horror
programme.desc: Lon Chaney Sr. was the original Phantom of the Opera, but there have been other notable portrayals  and other notable phantoms!

programme.title: 100 Years of Horror
programme.desc: Witches have been a favorite of fairy tales  and fright films  for centuries. Heres a wicked look at a covens worth of portrayals.

programme.title: 100 Years of Horror
programme.desc: More than just the Devil, demons have been a mainstay of horror films since the silent days.

programme.title: 100 Years of Horror
programme.desc: Abominable snowmen, mole people, creatures from black lagoons. All these half-human/half-beast hybrids are here  and more!

programme.title: 100 Years of Horror
programme.desc: Horror films have used people who didnt need makeup, were actually born disfigured, and managed to turn their misfortune into something of a career.

programme.title: 100 Years of Horror
programme.desc: King Kongs Fay Wray is probably the most famous scream queen of the horror genre, but youll be surprised to see who else made the list!

programme.title: 100 Years of Horror
programme.desc: Men didnt have a lock on the horror movie. There were plenty of frightful females to go around, as youll see in this salute to demonic dames.

programme.title: 100 Years of Horror
programme.desc: Ax-murderers, chainsaw-wielding madman, serial killers, cannibals  theyre all here  and more!
